member.name: P:Microsoft.Maui.Devices.DisplayInfo.Density
member.summary: Gets a value representing the screen density.

remarks.para: The density is the scaling or a factor that can be used to convert between physical pixels and scaled pixels. For example, on high resolution displays, the physical number of pixels increases, but the scaled pixels remain the same.

In a practical example for iOS, the Retina display will have a density of 2.0 or 3.0, but the units used to lay out a view does not change much. A view with a UI width of 100 may be 100 physical pixels (density = 1) on a non-Retina device, but be 200 physical pixels (density = 2) on a Retina device.

On Windows or UWP, the density works similarly, and may often relate to the scale used in the display. On some monitors, the scale is set to 100% (density = 1), but on other high resolution monitors, the scale may be set to 200% (density = 2) or even 250% (density = 2.5).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Maui.Storage.FilePicker
member.summary: Lets the user pick a file from the device's storage.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Maui.Storage.FilePicker.PickAsync(Microsoft.Maui.Storage.PickOptions)
member.param: File picker options to use; may be null
member.summary: Starts file picker for selecting files.
member.returns: File picking result object, or null when picking was cancelled by the user.
member.remarks: File types can be specified in order to limit files that can be selected, using a PickOptions object. Note that this method may re-throw platform specific exceptions that occured during file picking. When calling PickAsync() again while showing a file picker, the Task object that was returned from the first call is cancelled. Be sure to also handle the TaskCanceledException in this case.

member.param: File picker options to use; may be null

member.returns: File picking result object, or null when picking was cancelled by the user.
member.remarks: File types can be specified in order to limit files that can be selected, using a PickOptions object. Note that this method may re-throw platform specific exceptions that occured during file picking. When calling PickMultipleAsync() again while showing a file picker, the Task object that was returned from the first call is cancelled. Be sure to also handle the TaskCanceledException in this case.

member.remarks: Note that the file picker title is only used on the Android platform.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maui.Storage.PickOptions.FileTypes
member.summary: List of file types that file file picker should return.
member.remarks: On Android and iOS the files not matching this list is only displayed grayed out. When the array is null or empty, all file types can be selected while picking. The contents of this array is platform specific; every platform has its own way to specify the file types. On Android you can specify one or more MIME types, e.g. "image/png"; also wild card characters can be used, e.g. "image/*". On iOS you can specify UTType constants, e.g. UTType.Image. On UWP, specify a list of extensions, like this: ".jpg", ".png".

member.name: T:Microsoft.Maui.Storage.SecureStorage
member.summary: Provides simple secure storage for key/value pairs.

remarks.para: Each platform uses the platform provided native API's for storing data securely:

item.term: iOS: Data is stored in KeyChain. Additional information on SecAccessible at:
Android: Encryption keys are stored in KeyStore and encrypted data is stored in a named shared preference container (PackageId.Microsoft.Maui.Essentials).
UWP: Data is encrypted with DataProtectionProvider and stored in a named ApplicationDataContainer (with a container name of ApplicationId.Microsoft.Maui.Essentials).

remarks.para: NOTE: On Android devices running below API 23 (6.0 Marshmallow) there is no AES available in KeyStore. As a best practice this API will generate an RSA/ECB/PKCS7Padding key pair stored in KeyStore (the only type supported in KeyStore by these lower API levels), which is used to wrap an AES key generated at runtime. This wrapped key is stored in Preferences.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Maui.Storage.SecureStorage.GetAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the decrypted value for a given Key.
member.returns: Decrypted string or null if key does not exist.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Maui.Storage.SecureStorage.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the encrypted key/value pair for the given key.
member.returns: Returns true if the key value pair was removed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Maui.Storage.SecureStorage.RemoveAll
member.summary: Removes all of the stored encrypted key/value pairs.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Maui.Authentication.WebAuthenticator
member.summary: A web navigation API intended to be used for Authentication with external web services such as OAuth.
member.remarks: This API helps with navigating to a start URL and waiting for a callback URL to the app. Your app must be registered to handle the callback scheme you provide in the call to authenticate.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Maui.Authentication.WebAuthenticator.AuthenticateAsync(System.Uri,System.Uri)
member.param: Url to navigate to, beginning the authentication flow.
Expected callback url that the navigation flow will eventually redirect to.
member.summary: Begin an authentication flow by navigating to the specified url and waiting for a callback/redirect to the callbackUrl scheme.
member.returns: Returns a result parsed out from the callback url.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Maui.Authentication.WebAuthenticatorResult
